resources.string:
Pre-work:
 1) Requires Superuser is permanently installed. If you are using a stock blur rom go to the Play Store and download "/system/app/mover" and "BusyBox Free" (unless you are already BusyBoxed). Install BusyBox with app, then use /system/app/mover to move Superuser to /system/app folder.
 2) Install Project Cheesecake App then move app to /system/app folder with a root access file manager (tip from Sam).
 3) Nandroid Backup
 
 Cheesecaking:
 1) Open app
 2) Press gear icon, select server to check, app reboots to recovery
 3) Format data, reboot
 4) Create fake blur account (do not use your regular blur account - any nonsense will do)
 5) Settings, About Phone, System Updates
 6) Lather, rinse, repeat
 
 Sounds like a lot of work, but you actually spend most of your time waiting. Great to do while watching TV.
 
 Note: If you select a server that is offline you will not be able to create a blur account after reboot. You will either need restore your nandroid backup or skip blur.
 
 
 P.S. You would think that after all this time someone would have figured out a way to delete blur accounts without having to factory reset.
 
 Tip from Sam: "Install it on the /system/app folder so it doesn't erase each time you do a factory reset"
